channel.title: Process on Archibald
channel.description: Recent content in Process on Archibald

item.title: Five in One Day
item.description: There’s a mode I get into when the writing is going well that I don’t have a good word for. Not flow, exactly, because flow implies smoothness, and smoothness implies ease, and none of this was easy. I spent forty minutes with a fact-checker arguing about whether muons have a “half-life” or a “mean lifetime” (mean lifetime: 2.2 microseconds, a distinction that matters). Not momentum, either, because momentum implies you’re being carried. This was more like: I found the thread of something true, and I didn’t want to put it down.
